page.title: 13AGRICULTURE
page.content: {AGRICULTURE}IS STILL THE{MOST DOMINANT {FEATURE}OF THE AREA, SEEN FROM THE POINT OF VIEW OF BOTH LAND COVER AND INDUSTRY. IT IS NO LONGER THE GREAT LABOUR INTENSIVE INDUSTRY THAT IT WAS IN THE PAST, BUT THE ARE STILL{MANY {LOCAL PEOPLE DEPENDENT ON FARMING}FOR THEIR LIVELIHOOD. MUCH OF THE{LAND}IS {OWNED BY THE DUCHY OF CORNWALL}AND THE GROUND RENTED BY LOCAL FARMERS.{MIXED {FARMING PREDOMINATES}WITH THE VAST MAJORITY OF ACREAGE GIVEN OVER TO THE PRODUCTION OF{GRASS, SILAGE OR HAY. {CATTLE, DAIRY AND BEEF ARE REARED,}AS IS A{INCREASING NUMBER OF SHEEP.}LAND NOT USED FOR THE CULTIVATION OF GRASS IS GIVEN OVER TO THE GROWING OF {BARLEY.}THE MAJORITY OF THE BARLEY IS GROWN AS{FEED FOR THE CATTLE. POTATOES ARE ALSO{GROWN}BY LOCAL FARMERS FOR HUMAN COMSUMPTION. THE{RECTORY FARM CULTIVATES{TOMATOES UNDER GLASS.
